intro: Geunsia serrulata f. anisophylla, commonly known as the serrated leaf form of the genus Geunsia, is a variant of a plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive serrated leaf margins and a unique leaf structure that differs from the typical form of the species. The plant exhibits a compact growth habit with finely divided leaves that give it a delicate appearance. It is often found in moist, shady environments, thriving in woodland or rocky habitats. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for taxonomists and horticultural enthusiasts alike.
